<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good morning. </strong>After a one-year absence due to the pandemic, the Scripps National Spelling Bee finals return tonight, but with an entirely new slate of judges: iPhones that autocorrect to "ducking," the red squiggly line, and people who end relationships over the wrong use of "your." <div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/07/china-tightens-regulations-tech-companies?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Great Chinese Tech Spanking of 2021
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/07/china-tightens-regulations-tech-companies?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="The Wall Street bull under the Chinese flag's shadow" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81Njg2L3dhbGxfc3RyZWV0X2J1bGxfYW5kX2NoaW5lc2VfZmxhZy5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">NYC-listed, Beijing-based companies have been thrown on a bucking bronco by the Chinese government this year. And the g-forces have only been ramping up this week as China seeks to curtail its tech giants’ power and get a tighter grip on the data they hold.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The crackdown has fully spooked investors: More than $800 billion of market value has <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-07-07/down-831-billion-china-tech-firm-selloff-may-be-far-from-over?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">been wiped</a> from Chinese tech giants since a February peak; ride-hailing company Didi has lost <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-07-07/didi-extends-drop-after-sliding-below-ipo-price-on-crackdown?sref=KkPzpZvz" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">more than $17 billion</a> in value since Monday. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">A brief timeline </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In April, China blocked Jack Ma’s Ant Group from going public (it was on track to be the biggest IPO...ever) and forced the company to restructure.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">One month later, China’s Cyberspace Administration called out 105 apps, including ByteDance-owned Douyin (better known as TikTok in the US), for collecting and illegally accessing user data.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Then last month, Chinese regulators reportedly <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/chinese-regulators-suggested-didi-delay-its-u-s-ipo-11625510600?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tried to delay</a> ride-hailing giant Didi Chuxing’s IPO. When Didi decided to go public anyway last week, the government halted new app downloads and user signups in China. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The latest: </strong>The China Securities Regulatory Commission is planning to <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-07-07/china-mulls-closing-loophole-used-by-tech-giants-for-u-s-ipos?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">close a legal loophole </a>that has long been used by major Chinese companies, including Alibaba and Tencent, to go public in the US. The change would force companies classified under a certain corporate structure (known as the Variable Interest Entity model if you want to sound smart af) to seek the government’s approval before listing shares in the US or Hong Kong. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>all this could lead to a possible techxodus of <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/299ba00b-dfef-4c53-88a2-e6725d14025d?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">up to $2 trillion</a> worth of shares from US markets to China. Hong Kong could soon become the only place for non-Chinese investors to buy stakes in Chinese tech companies as regulators throttle firms listed in the US. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If you don’t believe us, the Hong Kong stock exchange’s holding company, Hong Kong Exchanges and Clearing, jumped as much as 6.2% yesterday.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2021%2F07%2F07%2Fchina-tightens-regulations-tech-companies" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
REAL ESTATE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/07/reliance-office-space-leaves-downtowns-futures-unstable?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
When Downtowns Turn Into Ghost Towns
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If there’s no one to buy a $15 Sweetgreen salad and bring it back to their desk to eat all alone, does downtown even exist? </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A jump in remote/hybrid work post-Covid could threaten central business districts in places like Boston and San Francisco, where office space makes up <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2021/07/07/upshot/downtown-office-vulnerable-even-before-covid.html?smid=tw-nytimes&smtyp=cur" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">70%–80%</a> of downtown real estate, per a new study from the NYT’s Upshot with CoStar. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The threat is real: </strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Even as some large banks </span><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/04/jpmorgan-chase-goldman-sachs-big-banks-announce-plans-bring-back-staff-summer?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">push</a></span><span> employees back into NYC skyscrapers, 74% of Fortune 500 CEOs around the country are </span><span><a href="https://fortune.com/2021/06/23/companies-reducing-office-space-fortune-500-ceos/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">looking to cut</a></span><span> office space. </span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>In downtown DC, daytime population took a nosedive, dropping </span><span><a href="https://www.brookings.edu/research/to-recover-from-covid-19-downtowns-must-adapt/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">82%</a></span><span> from February 2020 to February 2021.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The takeaway:</strong> Not all US downtowns are equally vulnerable to a tumbleweed-rolling-across-the-street future. Cities like San Diego and Nashville that have a more balanced makeup of residential, retail, and office space in their central districts could be more resilient coming out of the pandemic. But cities that aren’t as balanced will need to get creative in repurposing office space to avoid widespread vacancies and lower property tax revenue.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENERGY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/07/whats-behind-oil-squabble-gulf?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
What's Behind the Oil Squabble in the Gulf?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/07/whats-behind-oil-squabble-gulf?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Game of Risk, played in oil barrels " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMzkyL2dhbWVfb2Zfcmlza19wbGF5ZWRfaW5fb2lsX2JhcnJlbHMucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You might’ve seen recent headlines mentioning an unusual dispute among OPEC members that’s causing major uncertainty in the oil market, especially as gas prices continue to tick up in the US.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What’s going on: </strong>The United Arab Emirates <a href="https://www.aljazeera.com/economy/2021/7/7/saudi-uae-rivalry-takes-shape-amid-opec-spat-and-competing-hubs?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">blocked a plan</a> introduced by its friend and neighbor, Saudi Arabia, that would boost oil output in stages. The UAE wants to increase its own production by more than the Saudi plan allows for, so talks fell apart and oil prices hit a six-year high earlier this week.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The UAE’s strategy: </strong>The country is envisioning a future with more renewable energy and stricter climate-focused policies. It wants to pump (and sell) <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/behind-opec-deadlock-one-petro-state-looks-to-non-oil-future-11625659872?mod=hp_lead_pos6" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">as much oil</a> as it can <em>now</em> to snag as much market share as possible when demand hits its peak, estimated to be around 2030. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>the UAE and Saudi Arabia have brought riches to the Gulf through the extraction of oil; they want to <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/07/06/business/Saudi-Arabia-UAE-OPEC.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">use that wealth</a> to prepare for a time when fossil fuels won’t be as lucrative—and divergent strategies are leading them to butt heads.  </p>

GRAB BAG
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/07/key-performance-indicators-july-8?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Key Performance Indicators
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>Sotheby’s is auctioning a gigantic pear-shaped <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-07-07/sotheby-s-auctions-101-carat-diamond-in-new-milestone-for-crypto?sref=KkPzpZvz" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">101.38-carat diamond</a> this Friday, but there’s a decentralized twist: the auction house will accept bitcoin or ether as payment. With an expected sale price of as much as $15 million, it would be the most expensive physical object ever publicly offered for purchase using crypto.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote:</strong> A “very beautiful development.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That’s how President Trump described his class-action lawsuit against Facebook, YouTube, and Twitter, as well as most of their chief executives, for <a href="https://www.npr.org/2021/07/07/1013760153/donald-trump-says-he-is-suing-facebook-google-and-twitter-for-alleged-censorship?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">allegedly violating</a> his free speech rights. Experts say the challenge is a Hail Mary, but either way Trump began to send fundraising emails off of it immediately. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>Some misunderstandings around the Sha’Carri Richardson saga. (<a href="https://davidepstein.com/wait-weed-makes-you-faster/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">The Range Report</a>)</p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SHIPPING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/07/ever-given-free-suez-canal-multimillion-dollar-payout?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Whatever Refloats Your Boat
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/07/ever-given-free-suez-canal-multimillion-dollar-payout?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Ship stuck in Suez Canal" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80NTI1L3NoaXBfc3R1Y2tfaW5fc3Vlel9jYW5hbC5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Mahmoud Khaled/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">More than three months after the Ever Given got stuck in the Suez Canal—and our hearts—the 1,300-foot container ship was <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2021/07/07/business/ever-given-suez-canal/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">released</a> from boat jail yesterday following an investigation into whose fault the whole fiasco really was. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Ever Given’s <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/28/ever-given-still-stuck-suez-canal-salvagers-eye-progress?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">blockage</a> of a crucial trade route for six days in March racked up almost $1 billion in delays and rescue costs. So as soon as the ship was refloated, Egyptian officials seized it and said, “Somebody’s gotta pay for this.”</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The ship owner’s lawyers argued that the Suez Canal Authority (SCA) shouldn’t have allowed the ship into the canal in the first place because of the impending sandstorm that eventually caused the ship to run aground.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In the end, Ever Given’s owner and insurers paid the SCA an undisclosed amount—some Egyptian media <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/world/2021/jul/07/ever-given-released-from-suez-canal-after-compensation-agreed?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reported</a> $550 million and a “we’re sorry” tugboat—and the ship carrying goods worth hundreds of millions continued its much-delayed journey to the Netherlands.</p>

<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e865734bf6f7.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>

<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e86576e04837.jpg">

<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e8657887c532.jpg">

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

<font color="#000000">
The Puzzle Section
</font></a>
</h1>

<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Brew Mini: </strong>Completed by the Brew Crew in a record 32 seconds. <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/07/brew-mini-ciao?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Beat that</a>! </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Three Headlines and a Lie </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Can you spot the fake headline hidden among the three real news stories? </p>
<ol style="list-style-type: lower-alpha;">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Mayor of Texas town accidentally </span><span><a href="https://media2.giphy.com/media/CO4cjQ7mnHUP2yLh0s/giphy.gif?cid=ecf05e47qdt25xpay1agig5t6br2ec7x54wst0kf4hhkh012&rid=giphy.gif&ct=g" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sells</a></span><span> high school for $790,000</span>

style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nTECH\n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/07/china-tightens-regulations-tech-companies?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nThe Great Chinese Tech Spanking of 2021\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/07/china-tightens-regulations-tech-companies?utm_source=morning_brew\" style=\"text-decoration:none;border:none;\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"The Wall Street bull under the Chinese flag's shadow\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81Njg2L3dhbGxfc3RyZWV0X2J1bGxfYW5kX2NoaW5lc2VfZmxhZy5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNYC-listed, Beijing-based companies have been thrown on a bucking bronco by the Chinese government this year. And the g-forces have only been ramping up this week as China seeks to curtail its tech giants’ power and get a tighter grip on the data they hold.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe crackdown has fully spooked investors: More than $800 billion of market value has \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-07-07/down-831-billion-china-tech-firm-selloff-may-be-far-from-over?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebeen wiped\u003c/a\u003e from Chinese tech giants since a February peak; ride-hailing company Didi has lost \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-07-07/didi-extends-drop-after-sliding-below-ipo-price-on-crackdown?sref=KkPzpZvz\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emore than $17 billion\u003c/a\u003e in value since Monday. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eA brief timeline \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn April, China blocked Jack Ma’s Ant Group from going public (it was on track to be the biggest IPO...ever) and forced the company to restructure.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOne month later, China’s Cyberspace Administration called out 105 apps, including ByteDance-owned Douyin (better known as TikTok in the US), for collecting and illegally accessing user data.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThen last month, Chinese regulators reportedly \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/chinese-regulators-suggested-didi-delay-its-u-s-ipo-11625510600?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etried to delay\u003c/a\u003e ride-hailing giant Didi Chuxing’s IPO. When Didi decided to go public anyway last week, the government halted new app downloads and user signups in China. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe latest: \u003c/strong\u003eThe China Securities Regulatory Commission is planning to \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-07-07/china-mulls-closing-loophole-used-by-tech-giants-for-u-s-ipos?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eclose a legal loophole \u003c/a\u003ethat has long been used by major Chinese companies, including Alibaba and Tencent, to go public in the US. The change would force companies classified under a certain corporate structure (known as the Variable Interest Entity model if you want to sound smart af) to seek the government’s approval before listing shares in the US or Hong Kong. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eall this could lead to a possible techxodus of \u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/299ba00b-dfef-4c53-88a2-e6725d14025d?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eup to $2 trillion\u003c/a\u003e worth of shares from US markets to China. Hong Kong could soon become the only place for non-Chinese investors to buy stakes in Chinese tech companies as regulators throttle firms listed in the US. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIf you don’t believe us, the Hong Kong stock exchange’s holding company, Hong Kong Exchanges and Clearing, jumped as much as 6.2% style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIf there’s no one to buy a $15 Sweetgreen salad and bring it back to their desk to eat all alone, does downtown even exist? \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eA jump in remote/hybrid work post-Covid could threaten central business districts in places like Boston and San Francisco, where office space makes up \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2021/07/07/upshot/downtown-office-vulnerable-even-before-covid.html?smid=tw-nytimes\u0026smtyp=cur\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e70%–80%\u003c/a\u003e of downtown real estate, per a new study from the NYT’s Upshot with CoStar. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe threat is real: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eEven as some large banks \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/04/jpmorgan-chase-goldman-sachs-big-banks-announce-plans-bring-back-staff-summer?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epush\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e employees back into NYC skyscrapers, 74% of Fortune 500 CEOs around the country are \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://fortune.com/2021/06/23/companies-reducing-office-space-fortune-500-ceos/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elooking to cut\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e office space. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIn downtown DC, daytime population took a nosedive, dropping \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.brookings.edu/research/to-recover-from-covid-19-downtowns-must-adapt/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e82%\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e from February 2020 to February 2021.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe takeaway:\u003c/strong\u003e Not all US downtowns are equally vulnerable to a tumbleweed-rolling-across-the-street future. Cities like San Diego and Nashville that have a more balanced makeup of residential, retail, and office space in their central districts could be more resilient coming out of the pandemic. But cities that aren’t as balanced will need to get creative in repurposing office space to avoid widespread vacancies and lower property tax revenue.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat’s going on: \u003c/strong\u003eThe United Arab Emirates \u003ca href=\"https://www.aljazeera.com/economy/2021/7/7/saudi-uae-rivalry-takes-shape-amid-opec-spat-and-competing-hubs?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eblocked a plan\u003c/a\u003e introduced by its friend and neighbor, Saudi Arabia, that would boost oil output in stages. The UAE wants to increase its own production by more than the Saudi plan allows for, so talks fell apart and oil prices hit a six-year high earlier this week.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe UAE’s strategy: \u003c/strong\u003eThe country is envisioning a future with more renewable energy and stricter climate-focused policies. It wants to pump (and sell) \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/behind-opec-deadlock-one-petro-state-looks-to-non-oil-future-11625659872?mod=hp_lead_pos6\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eas much oil\u003c/a\u003e as it can \u003cem\u003enow\u003c/em\u003e to snag as much market share as possible when demand hits its peak, estimated to be around 2030. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ethe UAE and Saudi Arabia have brought riches to the Gulf through the extraction of oil; they want to \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/07/06/business/Saudi-Arabia-UAE-OPEC.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003euse that wealth\u003c/a\u003e to prepare for a time when fossil fuels won’t be as lucrative—and divergent strategies are leading them to butt
